title: Angular Component Options Schema
description: Creates a new Angular component. Components are the basic building blocks of Angular applications. Each component consists of a TypeScript class, an HTML template, and an optional CSS stylesheet. Use this schematic to generate a new component in your project.

path.description: The path where the component files should be created, relative to the current workspace. If not provided, a folder with the same name as the component will be created in the project's `src/app` directory.

project.description: The name of the project where the component should be added. If not specified, the CLI will determine the project from the current directory.

name.description: The name for the new component. This will be used to create the component's class, template, and stylesheet files. For example, if you provide `my-component`, the files will be named `my-component.component.ts`, `my-component.component.html`, and `my-component.component.css`.
name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the component?

displayBlock.description: Adds `:host { display: block; }` to the component's stylesheet, ensuring the component renders as a block-level element. This is useful for layout purposes.

inlineStyle.description: Include the component's styles directly in the `component.ts` file. By default, a separate stylesheet file (e.g., `my-component.component.css`) is created.

inlineTemplate.description: Include the component's HTML template directly in the `component.ts` file. By default, a separate template file (e.g., `my-component.component.html`) is created.

standalone.description: Generate a standalone component. Standalone components are self-contained and don't need to be declared in an NgModule. They can be used independently or imported directly into other standalone components.

viewEncapsulation.description: Sets the view encapsulation mode for the component. This determines how the component's styles are scoped and applied.

changeDetection.description: Configures the change detection strategy for the component.

prefix.description: A prefix to be added to the component's selector. For example, if the prefix is `app` and the component name is `my-component`, the selector will be `app-my-component`.

style.description: Specify the type of stylesheet to be created for the component, or `none` to skip creating a stylesheet.

type.description: Append a custom type to the component's filename. For example, if you set the type to `container`, the file will be named `my-component.container.ts`.

skipTests.description: Skip the generation of unit test files `spec.ts`.

flat.description: Create the component files directly in the project's `src/app` directory instead of creating a new folder for them.

skipImport.description: Do not automatically import the new component into its closest NgModule.

selector.description: The HTML selector to use for this component. If not provided, a selector will be generated based on the component name (e.g., `app-my-component`).

skipSelector.description: Skip the generation of an HTML selector for the component.

module.description: Specify the NgModule where the component should be declared. If not provided, the CLI will attempt to find the closest NgModule in the component's path.

export.description: Automatically export the component from the specified NgModule, making it accessible to other modules in the application.

exportDefault.description: Use a default export for the component in its TypeScript file instead of a named export.

ngHtml.description: Generate component template files with an '.ng.html' file extension instead of '.html'.
